abstract_summ: Also, we can use the model to quantify the effects of strategies which include switching between different containment policies at pre-determined points in time.This article proposes a time dynamic prediction model with competing risks for the infected individual and develops a simple tool for policy makers to compare different strategies in terms of when to implement the strictest containment measures and how different treatments can increase or suppress infected cases.This article proposes a time dynamic prediction model with competing risks for the infected individual and develops a simple tool for policy makers to compare different strategies in terms of when to implement the strictest containment measures and how different treatments can increase or suppress infected cases.Furthermore, our results stress the importance of easing social distancing restrictions gradually, rather than all at once, in order to prevent a second wave of infections.The rapid spread of the Coronavirus (COVID-19) confronts policy makers with the problem of measuring the effectiveness of containment strategies and the need to balance public health considerations with the economic costs of a persistent lockdown.
title_summ: Dynamic Modeling to Identify Mitigation Strategies for Covid-19 PandemicModeling the Post-Containment Elimination of Transmission of COVID-19An agent-based epidemic model REINA for COVID-19 to identify destructive policiesMathematical modeling of COVID-19 containment strategies with considerations for limited medical resourcesA Stratified Model to Quantify the Effects of Containment Policies on the Spread of COVID-19A flexible COVID-19 model to assess mitigation, reopening, virus mutation and other changesDynamic Modeling COVID-19 for Comparing Containment Strategies in a Pandemic Scenario.Containment efficiency and control strategies for the Corona pandemic costsDynamic Competing Risk Modeling COVID-19 in a Pandemic ScenarioManagement strategies in a SEIR model of COVID 19 community spreadPublic Health Policy: COVID-19 Epidemic and SEIR Model with Asymptomatic Viral CarriersFacing the COVID-19 epidemic in NYC: a stochastic agent-based model of various intervention strategiesHealthcare impact of COVID-19 epidemic in India: A stochastic mathematical model
title_abstract_phrases: Containment efficiency and control strategies for the Corona pandemic costsThe rapid spread of the Coronavirus (COVID-19) confronts policy makers with the problem of measuring the effectiveness of containment strategies and the need to balance public health considerations with the economic costs of a persistent lockdown.Furthermore, our results stress the importance of easing social distancing restrictions gradually, rather than all at once, in order to prevent a second wave of infections.Also, we can use the model to quantify the effects of strategies which include switching between different containment policies at pre-determined points in time.The model suggests that testing strategies can be equally effective as social distancing, though at much lower economical costs.Mathematical modeling of COVID-19 containment strategies with considerations for limited medical resourcesThe outbreak of SARS-CoV-2 in China has spread around the world, infecting millions and causing governments to implement strict policies to counteract the spread of the disease.
